content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://water.usgs.gov/GIS/metadata/usgswrd/fgdc-std-001-1998.xsd">  <idinfo>   <citation>    <citeinfo>     <origin>Donald R Pool</origin>     <origin>Stanley Leake</origin>     <origin>Jesse Dickinson</origin>     <pubdate>2014</pubdate>     <title>Digital geospatial data of the thickness of the Chinle-Moenkopi confining unit in the Upper Colorado River Basin</title>     <geoform>Raster Digital Data Set</geoform>     <pubinfo>      <pubplace>Reston, Virginia</pubplace>      <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>     </pubinfo>     <onlink>http://water.usgs.gov/lookup/getspatial?ucrb_chinle_thk</onlink>    </citeinfo>   </citation>   <descript>    <abstract>These raster data of the thickness of the Chinle formation in the Upper Colorado River Basin (UCRB) were created for the purpose of developing a generalized predevelopment groundwater flow model of the Mesozoic and Paleozoic aquifers in the Upper Colorado River Basin and use that model along with a few recharge estimates to estimate water budgets for the aquifers including associated groundwater contributions to the Colorado River surface water system. The modeling exercise also explored considerations for development of a more detailed groundwater flow model that would include all of the major aquifers in the Upper Colorado River Basin.</abstract>    <purpose>These data were derived from various other sources (maps) in order to present a cohesive thickness surface of the Chinle-Moenkopi confining unit in the Upper Colorado River Basin for use in the development of the Upper Colorado River Basin Groundwater Flow Model.</purpose>    <supplinf>Data are as current as the publications that provided the information and maps.  For stream elevation the DEMs were processed to determine the minimum elevation within each 500m. \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffducrb_500m_minlsa.tif\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</supplinf>   </descript>   <timeperd>    <timeinfo>     <sngdate>      <caldate>2013</caldate>     </sngdate>    </timeinfo>    <current>See Supplemental Info</current>   </timeperd>   <status>    <progress>Complete</progress>    <update>None planned</update>   </status>   <spdom>    <bounding>     <westbc>-112.979607578</westbc>     <eastbc>-105.320722038</eastbc>     <northbc>43.531871528</northbc>     <southbc>34.329287549</southbc>    </bounding>   </spdom>   <keywords>    <theme>     <themekt>None</themekt>     <themekey>inlandWaters</themekey>     <themekey>groundwater</themekey>     <themekey>confining unit</themekey>    </theme>    <place>     <placekt>None</placekt>     <placekey>Colorado</placekey>     <placekey>Arizona</placekey>     <placekey>Utah</placekey>     <placekey>New Mexico</placekey>    </place>   </keywords>   <accconst>None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.</accconst>   <useconst>None. Users are advised to read the data set's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.</useconst>   <ptcontac>    <cntinfo>     <cntorgp>      <cntorg>U.S. Geological Survey, Southwest Region</cntorg>      <cntper>Donald R Pool</cntper>     </cntorgp>     <cntpos>Hydrologist</cntpos>     <cntaddr>      <addrtype>mailing address</addrtype>      <address>520 North Park Avenue</address>      <city>Tucson</city>      <state>AZ</state>      <postal>85721</postal>     </cntaddr>     <cntvoice>520-670-6671 x258</cntvoice>     <cntfax>520-670-5592</cntfax>     <cntemail>drpool@usgs.gov</cntemail>    </cntinfo>   </ptcontac>   <browse>    <browsen>http://water.usgs.gov/GIS/browse/UCRB_Chinle_thk.jpg</browsen>    <browsed>Illustration of the dataset.</browsed>    <browset>JPG</browset>   </browse>   <native>Environment as of Metadata Creation: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 10.2 (Build 3497) Service Pack [N/A] (Build [N/A])</native>  </idinfo>  <dataqual>   <attracc>    <attraccr>Initial digitizing of maps and figures included a visual check to be sure all linework was present, and all lines were labelled correctly.</attraccr>   </attracc>   <logic>No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.</logic>   <complete>Data set is considered complete for the information presented. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.</complete>   <posacc>    <horizpa>     <horizpar>A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.</horizpar>    </horizpa>    <vertacc>     <vertaccr>A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.</vertaccr>    </vertacc>   </posacc>   <lineage>    <srcinfo>     <srccite>      <citeinfo>       <origin>Freethey, Geoffrey W., Kimball, B.A., Hood, J.W.</origin>       <pubdate>1988</pubdate>       <title>General hydrogeology of the aquifers of the Mesozoic age, Upper Colorado Rover Basin - excluding the San Juan Basin- Colorado, Utah, Wyoming, and Arizona: Hydrologic Atlas 698, 14 maps on 2 sheets:col</title>       <geoform>Paper Map</geoform>       <pubinfo>        <pubplace>Reston, VA</pubplace>        <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>       </pubinfo>       <onlink>http://pubs.er.usgs.gov/publication/ha698</onlink>      </citeinfo>     </srccite>     <typesrc>Digital and/or Hardcopy Resources</typesrc>     <srctime>      <timeinfo>       <sngdate>        <caldate>1988</caldate>       </sngdate>      </timeinfo>      <srccurr>publication date</srccurr>     </srctime>     <srccitea>HA-698, Plate 2, Fig 15</srccitea>     <srccontr>Thickness contours of the UCRB, except for the San Juan Basin area</srccontr>    </srcinfo>    <srcinfo>     <srccite>      <citeinfo>       <origin>Huffman, A. Curtis, Jr. ; Condon, Steven M.</origin>       <pubdate>1993</pubdate>       <title>Stratigraphy, structure, and paleogeography of Pennsylvanian and Permian rocks, San Juan Basin and adjacent areas, Utah, Colorado, Arizona, and New Mexico</title>       <geoform>Paper Map</geoform>       <pubinfo>        <pubplace>Reston, VA</pubplace>        <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>       </pubinfo>       <onlink>http://pubs.er.usgs.gov/publication/b1808O</onlink>      </citeinfo>     </srccite>     <typesrc>Digital and/or Hardcopy Resources</typesrc>     <srctime>      <timeinfo>       <sngdate>        <caldate>1993</caldate>       </sngdate>      </timeinfo>      <srccurr>publication date</srccurr>     </srctime>     <srccitea>Bulletin 1808-O</srccitea>     <srccontr>Data at boreholes and outcrops, depth to base of Entrada sandstone (base of Chinle Fm), depth to top of preCambrian rocks.</srccontr>    </srcinfo>    <procstep>     <procdesc>Digitized from georeferenced tif file - thickness contours from HA-698, Plate 1, Figure 10, which covered most of UCRB. Contours were modified to allow extrapolation to the margins of the unit.</procdesc>     <procdate>2013</procdate>    </procstep>    <procstep>     <procdesc>Digitized from georeferenced tif file - Subsurface and outcrop data in the San Juan Basin area, borehole locations/identifiers/depth to Entrada sandstone (aka depth to top of Chinle Fm), and depth to top of preCambrian.</procdesc>     <procdate>2013</procdate>    </procstep>    <procstep>     <procdesc>Contour line data were coverted to raster data using ArcMap "Topo to Raster" tool, to generate a hydrologically corrected surface raster. Test contours were created from the raster and compared to the original contour lines.</procdesc>     <procdate>2013</procdate>    </procstep>    <procstep>     <procdesc>Created ASCII file of raster using ESRI "Raster to ASCII" tool.</procdesc>     <procdate>2014</procdate>    </procstep>   </lineage>  </dataqual>  <spdoinfo>   <direct>Raster</direct>   <rastinfo>    <rasttype>Grid Cell</rasttype>    <rowcount>202</rowcount>    <colcount>124</colcount>    <vrtcount>1</vrtcount>   </rastinfo>  </spdoinfo>  <spref>   <horizsys>    <planar>     <gridsys>      <gridsysn>Universal Transverse Mercator</gridsysn>      <utm>       <utmzone>12</utmzone>       <transmer>        <sfctrmer>0.9996</sfctrmer>        <longcm>-111.0</longcm>        <latprjo>0.0</latprjo>        <feast>500000.0</feast>        <fnorth>0.0</fnorth>       </transmer>      </utm>     </gridsys>     <planci>      <plance>row and column</plance>      <coordrep>       <absres>5000.0</absres>       <ordres>5000.0</ordres>      </coordrep>      <plandu>Meter</plandu>     </planci>    </planar>    <geodetic>     <horizdn>D_North_American_1983</horizdn>     <ellips>GRS_1980</ellips>     <semiaxis>6378137.0</semiaxis>     <denflat>298.257222101</denflat>    </geodetic>   </horizsys>  </spref>  <eainfo>   <detailed>    <enttyp>     <enttypl>Attribute Table</enttypl>     <enttypd>Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.</enttypd>     <enttypds>Producer defined</enttypds>    </enttyp>    <attr>     <attrlabl>VALUE</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Thickness, in feet</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Producer defined</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <rdom>       <rdommin>1</rdommin>       <rdommax>2277</rdommax>       <attrunit>feet</attrunit>      </rdom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>COUNT</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Unknown</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Producer defined</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <rdom>       <rdommin>1</rdommin>       <rdommax>1474</rdommax>       <attrunit>none</attrunit>      </rdom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>   </detailed>   <overview>    <eaover>The thickness raster dataset of the Chinle-Moenkopi confining unit and Paloeozoic rocks in the San Juan Basin region were generated from contours of equal thicknesses of the unit.</eaover>    <eadetcit>HA-698, Plate 1, Figure 10 (the majority of the Upper Colorado River Basin area) and subsurface and outcrop data in the San Juan area from Bulletin 1808-O, including published borehole data from geologic sections in OC-141 and OC-142.</eadetcit>   </overview>
